about.intro: I have always been a guy with his head in the clouds and because of this, I have a unique sense of creativity. My professional and sometimes childlike wonder make me really enjoyable to work with, which can help colleagues overcome any challenge.
about.originStory:
We all have our own big dreams when we are young. Mine was to spend my life doing something that I like.

I never considered working in the film industry because the reality of living in a small city made it almost impossible to believe. At that time I was finishing my apprenticeship as an electrician and I wasn’t really happy with my life.
The only thing that made me happy was my love for music, which I had carried with me since I was 6 years old.
The music in my life gave me the inspiration to redirect my future toward my passion for sound.

Then something amazing happened! Finding my way within that small world, I was fortunate enough to work at the national radio and television station, an experience that changed my life.
Two years there allowed me to learn all the basics about the world of sound for both music and radio/TV production, and I also discovered the existence of this art form called sound design.

Finally I knew what I wanted to do with my life, but it forced me to make a really hard decision: if I opted to study sound design I wanted to do it properly at a really good school, but I would have had to leave everything and everyone behind to chase that dream.
Not an easy decision to make, but sometimes you have to take risks, especially when it comes to spending the rest of your life doing something that you like.
So I made my decision. Because it was my choice, I wanted to save money and pay for school by myself, without letting my family help me. Then one day I was finally able to apply to the Sound Design program at Vancouver Film School.

I was impatiently waiting for school to start, but the thrill of sound design pushed me to begin experimenting and learning how to design sounds on my own.
When I was working on my first projects, I had some moments of weakness and I wondered if I was doing the right thing and if my work was good enough.
From all this, I learned how to persevere through hard times and more importantly, how to overcome challenges to achieve my goals.

news.title: New Equipment
news.text:
The first of a series of packages has arrived! I will slowly begin to open an editing suite for my freelancing works.
There is a plan for the future…

news.alt: Andrea with the other VFS students on graduation day
news.title: Graduation Day!
news.text: I still can’t believe that today we graduate! I want to say thanks to all my instructors for everything they taught me and I’m sure today it will be an incredible day. I’m looking at the future with more confidence now and let’s hope it will be brighter than ever!

news.alt: Andrea with the other VFS students in front of the Vancouver International Film Centre
news.title: Almost Over
news.text: We’re so close to the end of this incredible year! It has been a beautiful journey full of learning and fun. I am surprised how fast this last month has been and I’m pretty sure that we will finish really soon.

news.title: New Gear
news.text: I just received my new toy! I bought a beautiful software for sound design called Kyma made by Symbolic Sound and it’s AMAZING! I’m really looking forward to play and experiment with it.

works.title: Andrea Colosio – Demo Reel
works.description: This is my Sound Design Demo Reel

works.title: Looking Around
works.description: This is a project that I did in collaboration with Sara Fiechter. I provided the sound replacement to her stop-motion school project and mixed it in stereo.

works.title: Horizon Zero Dawn – VFS Final Sound Design Project
works.description: This is my final sound design project that I have done at Vancouver Film School. I am responsible for all the sounds replacement from the recordings, to the editing and the final mix as well. This is a stereo LtRt version of the original 5.1 mix that I have done in a Dolby approved theater. All the rights are reserved and belongs to Sony Interactive Entertainment Europe and Guerrilla Games.

works.title: Hostile Inn Episode 2 – Episodic Film Collaboration
works.description: I recorded and performed Foley, edited the music and recorded ADR as well as being the Re-Recording mixer for the Episode. This is the LtRt version of the original 5.1 Mix. This is the Locked Picture and not the final version.

works.title: Waves Test Package – Sound Design Project
works.description: This was a test project with the goal of creating a piece of sound design with a limited amount of audio assets and 24 hours of time at disposal. I used the Kyma software for the core of my sound design, mixed with other techniques.

works.title: Teto – Breakdown
works.description: This is a breakdown of the game Teto that I made a gameplay of. In this video I show our Wwise project and basically how the audio system for the game is structured.

works.title: Dynamic Dialogue System – Wwise Project
works.description: This project is an example of a basic dynamic dialogue structure for a racing game. I started recording the actor’s performance and subsequently I edited and processed all the recorded clips. Once completed, I implemented them in Wwise and created the dialogue structure to fit the required functionality.

works.title: Teto – Gameplay
works.description: This video is a walkthrough of a game that I collaborated on and my main role was creating the Sound Design, the Foley and recording the voices. I also have been part of the implementation between Wwise and the Unity Engine. My other main role was to be the point of contact between our Sound Design group of three people, the Programmer and the Game Designers.

works.title: Car Chase – Car Engines SFX Edit
works.description: This is a SFX editing project about car engines. I edited the two main cars of the chase and the related SFX. The project is the finished edit and has not been mixed.

works.title: City Soundscape – Wwise project
works.description: For this project I recorded some assets for creating an RTPC based soundscape, such as cars-bys, different traffic recordings, rain and thunder. Afterwards I implemented those sounds in Wwise and structure them accordingly to the appropriate behaviours.

works.title: TE Fire – Sound Design Edit
works.description: This is a short piece of sound design that I edited for this specific sequence. The project is the finished edit and has not been mixed.

works.title: Random Music Machine – Max MSP Patch
works.description: This Max Patch is an interactive virtual music machine. It allows the user to change all the parameters and create their own saveable presets. I included as well a button to randomize all the instruments and parameters.

works.title: World of Warcraft – Music Edit
works.description: This project is an audio replacement of the original trailer but just with music. I did the music edit for the whole piece as demonstration on how important the music in a trailer can be. The music is provided by 5Alarms - www.5alarmmusic.com
